member.name: T:UiCore.ArithmeticParser
member.summary: Contains functionality to parse and evaluate math arithmetic expressions.

member.name: M:UiCore.ArithmeticParser.Evaluate(System.String)
member.summary: Evaluate an arithmetic expression and output the result (i.e. "2+5" will output "7"). See remarks for more info on supported functions.
member.param: The arithmetic expression to evaluate.
member.exception: Thrown if the expression is not valid (contains unrecognized characters or a mismatched number of parantheses).
member.returns: The result of the expression.
member.remarks:
Supports addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and exponents. Also supports parantheses (with implied multiplcation) and negative numbers.
Uses order of operations: exponents, division, multiplication, subtraction, addition.
Whitespace and new-line characters are removed prior to evaluation, and the literal characters ×, ⋅, and ÷ are replaced with their representations *, *, and /.

member.name: M:UiCore.ArithmeticParser.IsValidString(System.String)
member.summary: Check if a string can be parsed as an expression.
member.param: The string to parse.
member.returns: True if it is a string that can be parsed. False if it contains invalid characters.

member.name: T:UiCore.AutoCompleteBehavior
member.summary: Adds basic auto-complete behavior to text boxes via attached properties. Created by Nimgoble.

member.name: F:UiCore.AutoCompleteBehavior.AutoCompleteItemsSource
member.summary: The collection to search for matches from.

member.name: F:UiCore.AutoCompleteBehavior.AutoCompleteStringComparison
member.summary: Whether or not to ignore case when searching for matches.

member.name: F:UiCore.AutoCompleteBehavior.AutoCompleteIndicator
member.summary: What string should indicate that we should start giving auto-completion suggestions. For example: @ If this is null or empty, auto-completion suggestions will begin at the beginning of the textbox's text.

member.name: M:UiCore.AutoCompleteBehavior.OnPreviewKeyDown(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: Used for moving the caret to the end of the suggested auto-completion text.

member.name: M:UiCore.AutoCompleteBehavior.OnTextChanged(System.Object,System.Windows.Controls.TextChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Search for auto-completion suggestions.

member.name: T:UiCore.BindableHighContrast
member.summary: When set up properly, allows a WPF control style to be triggered when the Windows High Contrast mode setting is changed. See remarks for details.
member.remarks: For the control or style in question that you want to monitor changes to high contrast in, set the property flat:BindableHighContrast.HighContrast = "{DynamicResource ResourceKey={x:Static Member=SystemParameters.HighContrastKey}}" in the control or style. Then you can use the trigger as such: <Trigger Property="flat:BindableHighContrast.HighContrast" Value="True"> ... </Trigger>. Visit https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18708794/how-can-i-fall-back-to-a-high-contrast-color-in-wpf for more information and source. This class is identical to the "SystemParameterProperties" class in the accepted answer.

member.name: T:UiCore.BrushFactory
member.summary: A class that creates brushes to be used in coloring the user interface.

member.name: M:UiCore.BrushFactory.Create(System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Create a brush based upon a single color.
member.param: The color to use.
member.returns: A SolidColorBrush that includes the color.

member.name: M:UiCore.BrushFactory.Create(System.String)
member.summary: Create a brush based upon a single color.
member.param: The hex value of the color to use.
member.returns: A SolidColorBrush that includes the color.

member.name: M:UiCore.BrushFactory.Create(System.Windows.Media.Color,System.Windows.Media.Color,System.Double)
member.summary: Create a brush based upon two colors, made into a linear gradient.
member.param: The first color.
The second color.
The angle of the gradient to be made.
member.returns: A LinearGradientBrush that includes the two colors.

member.name: M:UiCore.BrushFactory.CreateFromImage(System.Windows.Media.DrawingImage)
member.summary: Create a brush based upon an image.
member.param: The image to use.
member.returns: An ImageBrush containing this image.

member.name: M:UiCore.BrushFactory.CreateFromImage(System.Uri)
member.summary: Create a brush based upon an image.
member.param: The location, such as a web address or file location, of the image to use.
member.returns: An ImageBrush containing this image.

member.summary: Contains some SolidColorBrush fields for usage in High Contrast mode.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the checkbox should cycle through three states (rather than two) when clicked. The third state is the "Indeterminate" state, which can be checked via the IsIndeterminate property.

member.summary: Perform a click programattically. The checkbox responds the same way as if it was clicked by the user.

The green value of the color.

member.summary: Create a color based upon RGB values, with alpha transparency as well.

The blue value of the color.

member.summary: Create a color based upon a hex string.
member.param: The hex string. Should have 3, 6, or 8 characters (i.e. "FFF", "FF00FF", or "FF00FF00"). The starting hash is allowed.
member.exception: Thrown if the string is not a hex string, or incorrectly formatted (including if the string is not of the length 3, 6, or 8).

member.summary: Returns an RGB hex triplet string that corresponds to this color. Note that A (alpha) is dropped.
member.param: The color to convert to a hex string.

member.summary: Get the HSV values for a particular color.

The hue value of the color.
The saturation value of the color.
The value (also known as brightness) value of the color.

member.summary: Create a color based upon HSV values.
member.param: The hue of the color.
The saturation of the color.
The value of the color.
member.returns: Return a color that corresponds to these HSV values.

member.name: M:UiCore.ColorsHelper.GetX11Color(System.String)
member.summary: Get a color from the X11 Color table (System.Windows.Media.Colors) with a particular name.
member.param: The name of the color to get.

member.name: E:UiCore.FlatButton.SelectionChanged
member.summary: Raised if the button's IsSelected value is changed. This can be used to have the button act as a ToggleButton.

member.summary: Get or set the color scheme to use with the button.

member.name: P:UiCore.FlatButton.ClickOnPress

member.name: T:UiCore.FlatWindow
member.summary: A WPF window that has a custom, flat style and additional functionality.

member.name: P:UiCore.FlatWindow.HighContrastMode
member.summary: Get if the window's color scheme is a high contrast theme (and thus, the window is displaying high-contrast colors).

member.name: P:UiCore.FlatWindow.ColorScheme
member.summary: Get or set the color scheme to apply to the window.

member.name: P:UiCore.FlatWindow.CaptionDisplayType
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of the caption buttons (close, maximize, minimize). The actions may still be available via other methods even if the buttons are hidden.
member.remarks: Use the DisableMinimizeAction and DisableMaximizeAction methods to further prevent the user from being able to minimize or maximize the window. The standard ResizeMode property works as well.

member.name: P:UiCore.FlatWindow.CaptionHeight
member.summary: Get or set the height of the caption (title bar) area of the window. Default is 29.

member.name: P:UiCore.FlatWindow.TopRightElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the UI element to place in the top-right of the window, to the left of the caption buttons.

member.name: P:UiCore.FlatWindow.TopLeftElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the UI element to place in the top-left corner of the window.

member.name: P:UiCore.FlatWindow.ExcludeTopLeftElementFromChrome
member.summary: Get or set if the top-left element should be considered part of the window chrome or not. Set to true to exclude it from the window chrome.
member.remarks: This changes the IsHitTestVisibleInChrome property for the top-left element. If set to true, the element can be interacted with. If set to false, the element cannot be interacted with, and clicking, dragging, etc. acts as if you're clicking on the window's title bar.

member.name: P:UiCore.FlatWindow.ExcludeTopRightElementFromChrome
member.summary: Get or set if the top-right element should be considered part of the window chrome or not. Set to true to exclude it from the window chrome.
member.remarks: This changes the IsHitTestVisibleInChrome property for the top-right element. If set to true, the element can be interacted with. If set to false, the element cannot be interacted with, and clicking, dragging, etc. acts as if you're clicking on the window's title bar.

member.name: P:UiCore.FlatWindow.Background
member.summary: Get or set the background brush to use for the caption area (title bar). Use ContentBackground for the content area of the window.

member.name: M:UiCore.FlatWindow.DisableMaximizeAction
member.summary: Calls the native Windows method to disable the Maximize action (via the right-click menu and the like). Note that you'll want to update the CaptionDisplayType to remove the physical button.

member.name: M:UiCore.FlatWindow.DisableMinimizeAction
member.summary: Calls the native Windows method to disable the Minimize action (via the right-click menu and the like). Note that you'll want to update the CaptionDisplayType to remove the physical button.

member.name: M:UiCore.FlatWindow.DisableMinimizeAndMaximizeActions
member.summary: Calls the native Windows method to disable the Minimize and Maximize actions (via the right-click menu and the like). Note that you'll want to update the CaptionDisplayType to remove the physical buttons.

member.name: T:UiCore.FontSelectDialog

Color can be picked not only from the , but also from the .

member.name: P:UiCore.LinkTextBlock.TextBrush
member.summary: Get or set the standard foreground brush for the text. This overwrites the Foreground property.

member.name: P:UiCore.LinkTextBlock.HighlightBrush
member.summary: Get or set the brush for when the control has mouseover or keyboard focus.

member.name: P:UiCore.LinkTextBlock.DisabledBrush
member.summary: Get or set the brush for when the control is disabled.

member.name: P:UiCore.LinkTextBlock.AutoSetLinkFromText
member.summary: Get or set if the LinkTextBlock should automatically create a link based upon the Text property. See remarks for more details.
member.remarks:
When AutoSetLinkFromText is set to true, the LinkTextBlock attempts to open the link defined in the Text property when the user clicks on the control. For example, if this property is set to true and the Text property is set to "https://microsoft.com", the LinkTextBlock will open "https://microsoft.com" when the control is clicked, even if a Click event handler is not attached. Note that for web links, the scheme/protocol should be present (i.e. "http", "https", "ftp", etc.).
Note that the Click event will still fire even if this property is set to true.
If an error occurs while attempting to open the link, nothing happens. If a debugger is attached, the LinkTextBlock attempts to log a message to the debugger.

member.name: P:UiCore.LinkTextBlock.UnderlineOnHighlight
member.summary: Get or set if the text should be underlined when the control has mouseover or keyboard focus.

member.name: P:UiCore.LinkTextBlock.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this element is enabled in the user interface (UI).

member.name: P:UiCore.MenuButton.StaysOpen
member.summary: Get or set if the menu should close automatically. Remember to set the StaysOpenOnClick property for child menu items as well.

member.name: P:UiCore.MenuButton.ShowMenuArrow
member.summary: Get or set if an arrow should be shown to the right of the button content to indicate the button as a menu button.

member.name: M:UiCore.MessageDialog.InitializeComponent
member.summary: InitializeComponent

member.name: T:UiCore.MessageDialogImage
member.summary: The image to use when displaying a message dialog.

member.name: F:UiCore.MessageDialogImage.None
member.summary: No image is displayed. This may be good for generic messages, but is not recommended for situations where the user should pay attention to the message.

member.name: F:UiCore.MessageDialogImage.Error
member.summary: A white X on a red background is displayed. This is good for situations where an error or exception has occurred, or something isn't acting as intended.

member.name: F:UiCore.MessageDialogImage.Warning
member.summary: An exclamation point on a yellow triangle is displayed. This is good when informing the user about potential errors or unintended side effects.

member.name: F:UiCore.MessageDialogImage.Question
member.summary: A white question mark on a blue background is displayed. This is good when asking a question or when asking for confirmation for a routine task.

member.name: F:UiCore.MessageDialogImage.Hand
member.summary: A white exclamation point on a blue background is displayed. This is good for when wanting to alert the user about something that isn't considered a warning.

member.name: F:UiCore.MessageDialogImage.Info
member.summary: A white I on a blue background is displayed. This is good for generally informing the user about something, such as a task being completed or the response to a request.

member.name: F:UiCore.MessageDialogImage.Stop
member.summary: A red stop sign is displayed. This is good for informing the user that this action isn't valid in the current state, or that an unavoidable major issue has occurred.

member.name: F:UiCore.MessageDialogImage.Lock
member.summary: A yellow lock is displayed. This is good for situations where security or authentication are involved.

member.name: T:UiCore.MessageDialogImageConverter
member.summary: A helper class that can retrieve a BitmapImage from a MessageDialogImage.

member.name: M:UiCore.MessageDialogImageConverter.GetImage(UiCore.MessageDialogImage,UiCore.MessageDialogImageConverter.MessageDialogImageColor)
member.summary: Return a 32x32 image to use with a message dialog. If the MessageDialogImage argument is "None", then null is returned.
member.param: The image to display. If "None", then null is returned.
The color to use for the image. Use black or white for high-contrast themes.

member.name: T:UiCore.MessageDialogImageConverter.MessageDialogImageColor
member.summary: The color to use with a message dialog image.

member.name: F:UiCore.MessageDialogButtonDisplay.Auto
member.summary: If set, uses the OkButtonText, CancelButtonText, and DiscardButtonText properties to determine which buttons should be displayed. If a property is null, then the corresponding button isn't displayed.

member.name: F:UiCore.MessageDialogButtonDisplay.One
member.summary: Display only one button, the OK button. Outputs as MessageDialogResult.OK when clicked.

member.name: F:UiCore.MessageDialogButtonDisplay.Two
member.summary: Display two buttons, the OK and Cancel buttons. Outputs as MessageDialogResult.OK or MessageDialogResult.Cancel when clicked.

member.name: F:UiCore.MessageDialogButtonDisplay.Three
member.summary: Display three buttons, the OK, Discard, and Cancel buttons. Outputs as MessageDialogResult.OK, MessageDialogResult.Discard or MessageDialogResult.Cancel when clicked.

member.name: T:UiCore.SelectableItem
member.summary: Interaction logic for SelectableItem.xaml
SelectableItem

member.name: M:UiCore.SelectableItem.#ctor
member.summary: Create a SelectableItem to use with a SelectPanel.

member.name: M:UiCore.SelectableItem.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a SelectableItem to use with a SelectPanel, with the text preset.
member.param: The text to display in the item.

member.name: M:UiCore.SelectableItem.#ctor(System.String,System.Windows.Media.ImageSource,System.Double)
member.summary: Create a SelectableItem to use with a SelectPanel, with certain properties preset.
member.param: The text to display in the item.
The image to display in the item. (If the image is wider than 16 pixels, you may need to update the ImageWidth property.)
The left indent to apply to the item's content. The indent can be used to make an improvised tree view.

member.name: E:UiCore.SelectableItem.TextChanged
member.summary: Raised when the Text property is changed, either via updating the property or via the the user's text editing view.

member.name: P:UiCore.SelectableItem.Indent
member.summary: Get or set the left indent to apply to the item's content. This can be used to make an improvised tree view.

member.name: P:UiCore.SelectableItem.ShowCheckbox
member.summary: Get or set whether a checkbox should be displayed on the item. Checkboxes can make it easy to select mutliple items.

member.name: P:UiCore.SelectableItem.ImageWidth
member.summary: Get or set the width to afford to the image. By default, the width is set to 16, but larger images will require the width to be set higher.

member.name: P:UiCore.SelectableItem.ShowImage
member.summary: Get or set whether to display an image on the left side of the item. Set the image via the ImageSource property.

member.name: P:UiCore.SelectableItem.ImageSource
member.summary: Get or set the source for the image to show on the left side of the item. If set, the item automatically displays the image (unless AutoShowImageOnSourceSet is set to false).

member.name: P:UiCore.SelectableItem.AutoShowImageOnSourceSet
member.summary: Get or set whether the ShowImage property should be updated when the ImageSource property is set. Default is true.

member.name: P:UiCore.SelectableItem.Text
member.summary: Get or set the text to display within the item. This text can be edited by setting AllowTextEditing to true, or by calling .

member.name: P:UiCore.SelectableItem.RightText
member.summary: Get or set the text to display on the far-right side of the item. This text cannot be edited directly by the user.

member.name: P:UiCore.SelectableItem.TextTrimming
member.summary: Get or set the text trimming behavior to use when the text overflows the visible area.

member.name: P:UiCore.SelectableItem.TextUnderlineOnMouseOver
member.summary: Get or set if the text should have an underline effect when the mouse is over the text. This is enabled by default when AllowTextEditing is set to "true", but otherwise is disabled.

member.name: P:UiCore.SelectableItem.SelectOnFocusTextEdit
member.summary: Get or set whether all of the text should be selected when the text-editing text box recieves focus.

member.name: P:UiCore.SelectableItem.AllowTextEditing
member.summary: Get or set whether the user should be allowed to edit the text in the Text property. If enabled, a text box will appear when the user clicks on the text.
member.remarks: While editing, pressing "Enter" will confirm the edit, while pressing "Escape" will cancel the operation.

member.name: M:UiCore.SelectableItem.DisplayEditText
member.summary: Display the text editing view to the user. This is the same as the user clicking on the text while AllowTextEditing is set to true.
member.remarks: This method will activate the text editing view even if AllowTextEditing is set to false.

member.name: M:UiCore.SelectableItem.ConfirmEdit
member.summary: Confirm the user's edit to the text, as changed via the text editing view. Also exits the text editing view. This can only be called when in the text editing view.
member.exception: Thrown if this item is not in the text editing view.

member.name: M:UiCore.SelectableItem.CancelEdit
member.summary: Cancel the user's edit to the text and exits the text editing view (if in the view). This can be called at any time.

member.name: M:UiCore.SelectableItem.InitializeComponent
member.summary: InitializeComponent

member.name: M:UiCore.SelectableUserControl.UpdateBrushes
member.summary: Make sure the control's visuals match the set brush properties. Call this if the parent's ColorScheme was changed.

member.name: M:UiCore.SelectableUserControl.ApplyColorScheme(UiCore.ColorScheme)
member.summary: When overridden by a derived class, this method is automatically called each time the color scheme is updated by the parent SelectPanel. Use this to update child controls.
member.param: The new color scheme.

member.summary: Get a collection of items that have been selected, returned as a certain type (that inherits from SelectableUserControl).
member.typeparam: The type to return the selected items as. It must inherit from SelectableUserControl.

member.name: P:UiCore.SelectPanel.UseLighterBorder
member.summary: Use a lighter border color when applying color schemes. Note that this does not apply in high-contrast mode.

member.name: P:UiCore.SelectPanel.AllowParentScrolling
member.summary: Set whether the SelectPanel should allow its parent to scroll if the SelectPanel doesn't need to scroll. Note that enabling this may disable any child items from scrolling.

member.summary: Reads a 4-byte floating point value from the current stream using big-endian encoding and advances the position of the stream by four bytes.

member.returns: The string read from the stream.

member.summary: Create a StringInputDialog with nothing preset.

member.summary: Create a StringInputDialog with a color scheme.
member.param: The color scheme to use for the window.

member.name: M:UiCore.StringInputDialog.#ctor(UiCore.ColorScheme,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a StringInputBox with prefilled values.
member.param: The color scheme to use for the window.
The title of the window.
The description to give to the user.
The value to place in the text box. By default, the text box is empty.

member.name: P:UiCore.StringInputDialog.Value
member.summary: Get or set the text value of the input dialog's text box.

member.name: P:UiCore.StringInputDialog.DialogResult
member.summary: Get the result of the dialog when it is closed. "False" refers to the user cancelling the operation, while "True" refers to the user confirming, by clicking "OK" or pressing the Enter key.

member.name: P:UiCore.StringInputDialog.EnterKeyConfirms
member.summary: Get or set whether the Enter key can be used to confirm the dialog. If enabled, pressing down the Enter key will be treated as if the user pressed "OK".

member.name: P:UiCore.StringInputDialog.EscapeKeyCancels
member.summary: Get or set whether the Escape key can be used to cancel the dialog. If enabled, pressing down the Escape key will be treated as if the user pressed "Cancel".

member.name: P:UiCore.StringInputDialog.SelectTextOnFocus
member.summary: Get or set whether all of the text in the text box should be selected when the text box receives focus.

member.name: P:UiCore.StringInputDialog.Description
member.summary: Get or set the description text to display about the text box. This text should describe what the user should enter into the text box.
member.remarks: Try to keep the description to about a sentence long. Ideally, the overall design of the program should make it apparent what the user should enter into the text box without reading the description.

member.name: M:UiCore.StringInputDialog.InitializeComponent
member.summary: InitializeComponent
